title: CSV Injection in Camptix

profile.name: Ian Dunn
profile.about: I'm a WordPress developer who maintains several small open source projects.

vulnerability_information:
Hello, Ian!

I see you tried to escape "=, -, +, @" in your code ([#151516](https://hackerone.com/reports/151516)), but let me show simple workaround.

I've made CSV injection by using this string ";=cmd|' /C calc'!A5" without doublequotes.

";" will bypass your trying to set the quote in the beginning of the string.

";" acts as a new cell separator.

Tested in the Excel 2016
vulnerability_information_html:
Hello, Ian!

I see you tried to escape "=, -, +, @" in your code (#151516), but let me show simple workaround.

I've made CSV injection by using this string ";=cmd|' /C calc'!A5" without doublequotes.

";" will bypass your trying to set the quote in the beginning of the string.

";" acts as a new cell separator.

Tested in the Excel 2016

activities.message:
Not working ) I'm still able to reproduce the issue even with your new lines of the code.
```
$alternate_delimiters = array( ';' );
$is_alternate_delimiter = in_array( $first_cell_character, $alternate_delimiters,    true );
```

I just delete all of the files in the camptix folder. Then just copy-paste all of the files from the attachment.
I tried to deactivate/activate plugins. But all the same)
Maybe I did something wrong?)

activities.message:
Hi, Ian,

Sure. File and video attached.

Maybe Wordpress cached something?

Also I'm using web server that works on Windows (Apache/2.4.12 (Win64) PHP/5.6.25). Maybe some functions have different interpretation there?

P.S. For example, money_format() is absent in PHP for Windows.
activities.markdown_message:
Hi, Ian,

Sure. File and video attached.

Maybe Wordpress cached something?

Also I'm using web server that works on Windows (Apache/2.4.12 (Win64) PHP/5.6.25). Maybe some functions have different interpretation there?

P.S. For example, money_format() is absent in PHP for Windows.

activities.message:
I don't think the difference is server-side. It looks like in the raw CSV file, the `;` is escaped with a `'` like it should be, so the cell looks like `"';=cmd|' /C calc'!A5"`. When your copy of Excel opens the file, though, it still treats the `;` as a cell delimiter.

When I open it in Excel 2013 and Excel 2016, it just displays as normal text, rather than being treated as a delimiter (see screenshot).

Do you have any ideas on how I can reproduce this. Maybe there's a setting in Excel that you have configured differently than I do?

Also, do you how to fix it in your copy of Excel?
activities.markdown_message:
I don't think the difference is server-side. It looks like in the raw CSV file, the ; is escaped with a ' like it should be, so the cell looks like "';=cmd|' /C calc'!A5". When your copy of Excel opens the file, though, it still treats the ; as a cell delimiter.

When I open it in Excel 2013 and Excel 2016, it just displays as normal text, rather than being treated as a delimiter (see screenshot).

Do you have any ideas on how I can reproduce this. Maybe there's a setting in Excel that you have configured differently than I do?

Also, do you how to fix it in your copy of Excel?

activities.message:
Hello, Ian.

I've tried on two different systems: Windows 7 with Excel 2013, Windows 10 with Excel 2016. Both works as well. Office was just installed, without any configuration.

But I inderstand why this one is not working with your setup. You open it in different way, creating blank file and getting the data from .csv. Normally user just open csv and then do some stuff.

Please open attached video. It will be in Russian user interface, so if it will be not usefull, I will re-record with English user interface.
activities.markdown_message:

activities.message:
For me, it doesn't work when opening the file with a double-click, or with `File > Open`. It only works if I import the file and manually choose `;` as the delimiter.

I wonder Excel's default settings are different based on the OS language. @kovshenin, would mind seeing if you can reproduce it on your system?
activities.markdown_message:
For me, it doesn't work when opening the file with a double-click, or with File > Open. It only works if I import the file and manually choose ; as the delimiter.

I wonder Excel's default settings are different based on the OS language. @kovshenin, would mind seeing if you can reproduce it on your system?

activities.message:
Hi @grande, could you please post a screenshot of your regional settings for your operating system? I'm interested to know whether the decimal symbol is set to the comma, which seems to be the default for the ru_RU locale. Are you able to reproduce the problem via double-click or File – Open if you change the decimal symbol to a period or change your regional settings altogether?

Thanks!
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @grande, could you please post a screenshot of your regional settings for your operating system? I'm interested to know whether the decimal symbol is set to the comma, which seems to be the default for the ru_RU locale. Are you able to reproduce the problem via double-click or File – Open if you change the decimal symbol to a period or change your regional settings altogether?

Thanks!

activities.message: Hi @kovshenin. Sure, screenshot in the attachment. I'm on Win 10. I've tried to reset additional parameters (кнопка Сбросить в Дополнительных параметрах), but still the same. No parameters were changed after installation (so it's there by default). You can see PoC in previous attachments "2-differen-ways-to-open-csv.mp4" and "test-fix-1.mp4".
activities.markdown_message: Hi @kovshenin. Sure, screenshot in the attachment. I'm on Win 10. I've tried to reset additional parameters (кнопка Сбросить в Дополнительных параметрах), but still the same. No parameters were changed after installation (so it's there by default). You can see PoC in previous attachments "2-differen-ways-to-open-csv.mp4" and "test-fix-1.mp4".

activities.message: Thanks @grande. Could you please try and reproduce the problem via double-click if you change the decimal symbol (разделитель целой и дробной части) to a period "." and the list-seperator (разделитель элементов списка) to a semicolon ";" in your OS regional settings? Thanks!
activities.markdown_message: Thanks @grande. Could you please try and reproduce the problem via double-click if you change the decimal symbol (разделитель целой и дробной части) to a period "." and the list-seperator (разделитель элементов списка) to a semicolon ";" in your OS regional settings? Thanks!

activities.message:
Hi @kovshenin!

I've changed decimal symbol to "."
List-separator already ";" (by default)

So it's still the same - reproducible.

But if change list-separator to ":" - injection is not working.
But by default it's ";"

Video here:
https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B7dXFhBiHKVNVWhyajNIeWc4N1E/view?usp=sharing

activities.message:
Ok, I was finally able to reproduce this by changing the `List separator` setting from `,` to `;`.

I think I've fixed it in the attached version. Would you mind testing it for bypasses?
activities.markdown_message:
Ok, I was finally able to reproduce this by changing the List separator setting from , to ;.

I think I've fixed it in the attached version. Would you mind testing it for bypasses?
